example.name: feature_implementation_with_task_list
example.scenario: Implementing a new "Config Export" feature using a task list in feature_tasks.md.
example.user_request: Start working on the tasks in feature_tasks.md.

step.description: Analyze the task list and codebase
step.approach: Read feature_tasks.md. Search for existing configuration and export logic (internal/config, internal/output). Result: Found that "JSON export" is already partially implemented, suggesting a re-ordering of tasks to leverage existing code first.
Update [ ] Task 1: Design Export Interface to [x] in feature_tasks.md. Implement `Exporter` interface in `internal/output/exporter.go`.

Realized that the task list didn't specify the output directory. PAUSE: Ask the user "Should exported configs go to a default directory like './exports' or be configurable?" User: "Make it configurable via a flag." Action: Added a sub-task to Task 2: "[ ] Add --output-dir flag to CLI".
Append to "Development Notes" in feature_tasks.md: "Decided to make export directory configurable via --output-dir based on user feedback. JSON implementation leverages internal/config/types.go."
